title: Strengthening Organizational Development Practical Competencies: Self-Directed Learning Design for Healthcare Professionals' Capability Enhancement

context.prior_knowledge: Requirement of intermediate theoretical background and practical experience
context.additional_context: Practical Competency Enhancement Program for Corporate Management/HR Professionals

learning_goals: Over a six-month course, learners acquire medical literature analysis and critical evaluation skills through three monthly structured independent tasks (analyzing two medical texts, creating comparative evaluation tables, proposing improvement plans) and achieve a performance score of 80% or higher in the final assessment.

Within a six-month course, learners develop a self-directed learning plan in three stages (self-diagnosis, goal setting, action plan), select two HR field case studies, apply SWOT analysis to write a report, and complete a practical case study achieving 80% or higher satisfaction in peer evaluations and instructor feedback.

Learners reflect on two or more of three or more peer feedback sessions, write and submit a two-page learning strategy improvement plan, and achieve a rating of "average" or higher in four of the five evaluation rubric criteria.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
